Shrubs <4 m. Leaves in whorls, <4 cm. Fruit globose, somewhat fleshy
Trees >4 m. Leaves in pairs, >4 cm. Fruit conical, woody
Leaves with 1 or 2 paler lines on upperside. Flowers without petals
Leaves compound. Flowers radially simmetric. Fruit dry
Leaves entire. Flowers bilaterally symmetric. Fruit fleshy
Leaves divided into 3 linear segments. Flowers yellow, bilaterally symmetric. Shrub lower than 1 m
Leaves with less than 7 leaflets. Fruit swollen, not winged
Some leaves with al least 7 leaflets. Fruit not swollen, winged at top
Flowers without petals, in leaf-axils. Leaves ovate, the apex often weakly 2-lobed
Leaves green on upperside, white-hairy on lowerside
Leaves petiolate. Flowers white, in umbrella-like inflorescences. Fruit fleshy
Leaves sessile. Flowers violet, in elongated inflorescences. Fruit dry
Flowers yellow, produced before leaves. Fruits red, elliptic, in leaf-axils
Flowers white, produced after leaves. Fruits dark, subglobose, not in leaf-axils
Petiole <1 cm. Petals fused. Inflorescence a raceme, not umbrella-like
Without spines. Flowers yellow. Fruit dry
With spines. Flowers not yellow. Fruit fleshy
Leaves not ending with a terminal leaflet (paripinnate)
Leaves ending with a terminal leaflet (imparipinnate)
Fruit stalks glabrous or with sparse simple hairs
Flowers yellow, not in spike-like inflorescences
Leaves lobed, palmately veined. Flowers never white nor reddish. Fruit fleshy
Evergreen. Flowers and fruits in an umbrella. Leaf margin not toothed
Deciduous. Flowers and fruits not in an umbrella. Leaf margin toothed
Flowers without petals. Inflorescence not umbrella-like
Fruit fleshy, mulberry-like. Leaves lobed in the upper part only, the lobes pointing forward
Fruit dry (acorn). Leaves lobed all round, the lobes not pointing forward
Leaves more or less triangular or rhombic
Leaves with a very different colour on the two faces
Leaf margin with sparse blunt teeth. Bark not papery. Fruits capsules, in racemes
Leaf margin entire. Flowers violet, >1 cm long, bilaterally symmetric, in erect racemes
Leaf margin toothed. Flowers not violet, <1 cm long, radially symmetric, not in erect racemes
Trees >10 m at maturity. Fruit peduncle with a transversal wing
Fruit fleshy. Some leaves often lobed
Small shrub. Leaves (actually modified stems) hairless, stinging. Fruit a red berry
Leaf margin entire. Spines on the twigs. Fruit dry, winged
Petals free, white. Fruit bluish at maturity, pruinose
Petals fused at base, yellowish green. Fruit first red then black, not pruinose
Leaf veins forming a clear net. Plants with unisexual flowers disposed in male and female spikes. Fruit a capsule (willows)
Leaves <4 times as long as wide
Leaves >4 times as long as wide
Leaves green on upperside, grey- to white hairy on lowerside
Tree >10 m at maturity. Leaf margin hairy
Shrubs <8 m at maturity. Leaf margin hairless
Flowers bilaterally symmetric. Fruit a legume
Petals 3, yellow, free. Leaves present in winter but absent in summer, sessile
Fruit fleshy. Leaf veins not ending in the teeth, forming a net
Fruit dry, surrounded by a wing. Leaf veins ending in the teeth
Fruits winged. Young twigs not sticky
Leaves wider in the middle, with max. 14 pairs of veins. Wing 3-lobed
Stems thread-like, winging around other plants. Plant without roots
Stems erect. Plant rooting in the ground
Stems jointed, with a toothed sheath at the base of each joint, often ending in a cone-like spike producing spores
Flowers pointing in all directions. Plant annual, without rhizome
Leafy parts of stem not flattened, <3 mm
Flowers absent (Pteridophytes) or without petals. Fruit absent (Pteridophytes) or dry
Plant without flowers, reproducing by spores. Stems ridged, jointed, with a toothed sheath at the base of each joint
Green stems never ending with a cone-like spike (fertile stems not green, originating at the end of winter and disappearing before the green stems are produced). Main stem evident
Plant a liana or with winding stems
Leaves with more than 7 leaflets. Flowers violet
Leaves with max. 7 leaflets. Flowers white
Leaves not compound, rounded in outline
Leaves divided only for 2/3-4/5 of their length
Plant spiny. Heads longer than wide. Flowers whitish
Plant not spiny. Heads wider than long. Flowers violet
Leaves not ending with a leaflet (paripinnate). Flowers yellow
Leaves ending with a leaflet (imparipinnate). Flowers pink or white
Flowers in long, leafless spikes. Stamens 4
Plant spiny or with stinging hairs
Plant spiny. Flowers with petals, in oval heads
Plant with stinging hairs. Flowers without petals, not in heads
Stems winding, >1.5 m. Leaves >5 cm wide
Leaves (at least the lower ones) petioled. Stems erect
Central flowers yellow, ray flowers white
Peripheral flowers of the head wider than the central ones and cleary irregular (bilaterally symmetric)
Petals fused at least at base
Petals white to whitish at least on upperside
Petals entire and flowers <1 cm across
Petals 2-lobed, toothed or fringed, if entire then flowers >1 cm across
Leaves with stipules, at least the upper ones in whorls of 4
Calyx hairless or with a few hairs only
Plant biennial or perennial, with glandular hairs at least in upper part
Capsule cylindrical, at least two times as long as calyx. Stems hairy all round
Petioles absent or <2 mm. Inflorescence cylindrical. Plant hairy
Leaves not parallel-veined or veins not visible
Stamens 2. Fruit more or less as long as wide
Stigma with 4 lobes forming a cross
Flowers in racemes originating in leaf-axils
Flowers in terminal leafless spikes, or solitary in leaf-axils
Stems hairless. Plant restricted to wet sites
Leaf base more or less truncate
Capsule globose, non heart-shaped at top. Leaves 3-lobed
Capsule strongly flattened, heart-shaped at top. Leaves not 3-lobed
Petals fused at least at base
Flowers bright-coloured, in long, spike-like inflorescences. Stems 4-angled. Plant restricted to wet sites
Flowers pale-pink, not in in long spike-like inflorescences. Stems cylindrical. Plant absent from wet sites
Flowers in apical whorls surrounded by bracts
At least the basal leaves >3 cm. Flowers purple, not in leaf-axils. Corolla with a long tube. Calyx absent
Flowers >5 mm, bright-coloured. Stamens more than 3
Leaves petiolate. Stems creeping. Flowers >1.5 cm
Leaves not parallel-veined. Corolla tube <5 mm
Leaves >4 cm wide. Flowers with mouth >7 mm wide and erect lobes, in leaf-axils
Flowers with a spur or a sac-like structure
Flowers white or greenish, petals free. Calyx absent. Leaves >1 cm wide.
Leaves >5 cm wide. Plant sticky at least in upper part
Corolla with the lower lip only, apparently with a single petal
Corolla 2-lipped or clearly with more than 1 petal
Fruit a cluster of four 1-seeded nutlets (observe the ovary with a lens!)
Flowers at least in part bright yellow
Margin of lower leaves toothed all round. Calyx strongly flattened. Upper lip ending with a short nose
Leaves 2, parallel-veined. Petals free. Calyx absent
At least the basal leaves >8 mm wide
Leaves odourless. Leaf margin toothed. Annual
Stamens included in the tube. Plant grey-hairy
Plant woody at base. Flowers pink
Fruit a capsule. Flowers either in long leafless racemes or solitary in leaf-axils
Fruit a cluster of four 1-seeded nutlets (extract the corolla and observe the ovary with a lens!). Flowers not in leafless racemes nor solitary in leaf-axils
Leaves without a clear petiole <1 cm wide. Flowers pale blue, in leaf-axils. Plant of humid sites
Leaves petiolate, >1 cm wide. Flowers not pale blue, in racemes. Plant of dry sites
Upper lip of flowers not hood-shaped
Calyx not 2-lipped, the teeth almost equal
Calyx 2-lipped, the teeth unequal, 3 on one side, 2 on the other
Leaves truncate to heart-shaped at base
Stems prostrate to ascending. Flowers in pairs in leaf-axils
At least the basal leaves >2 cm long
Flowers clearly peduncled, in short branched inflorescences
Calyx 2-lipped, with unequal teeth, 3 on one side, 2 on the other
Lower lip of flower with two conical outgrowths at base
Lower lip of flowers 3-lobed, with 2 well-developed lobes at base
Lower lip with basal lobes indistinct, or reduced to short teeth
Petals fused at base. Apex of leaflets not 2-lobed. Fruit a berry
Petals free. Apex of leaflets 2-lobed. Fruit dry
Calyx present. Flowers not solitary. Fruit fleshy (strawberry)
Inflorescences more or less globose. Flowers with a small basal bract, usually with a short peduncle
Fruit curved or spirally arranged. Flowers blue-violet
Inflorescences oval to cylindrical, at least 3 times as long as wide
Inflorescences globose or wider than long
Plant woody at least at base
Inflorescences at least 3 time as long as wide
Inflorescences less than 3 times as long as wide
Standard (upper petal) finely folded. Fruit straight
With spines on stems or leaves
Internal bracts radiating all round the heads. Flowers <1.5 cm long, in a flattened disc
Heads flattened, surrounded by radiating bracts. Leaves not white-hairy on lowerside
Heads crowded at top of stems
Plant totally submerged or with leaves floating on water
Plant terrestrial, or if aquatic then at least the leaves emerging from water
Plants always without flowers (Pteridophytes) or with flowers without petals
Plants with flowers and with petals
Plant without flowers (fern). Leaves all basal (no stem)
Leaves densely covered by brown scales on lowerface
Plant with flowers and with leafy stems
Plant without flowers (fern), the leaves all basal (without a stem)
Sporangia marginal. Leaf segments ca. as long as wide, fan-shaped. Plant restricted to humid mossy rocks
Flowers in heads with an involucre of bracts
Tubular (regular) flowers absent, all flowers ligulate (asymmetrical)
Tubular flowers present, ligulate flowers present only at the margin of heads or absent
Pappus of feather-like hairs (observe the central fruits!)
Flowers violet. Heads with max. 5 flowers
Flowers pale blue. Heads with more than 5 flowers
Fruits with a pappus of hairs
Pappus hairs feather-like, at least in the central fruits (lens!)
Leaves not spinulose at margin. Fruit cylindrical
Beak of fruit inserted in the center of a small membranous crown (lens!)
Involucre of heads hemispherical to oval, max 3 times as long as wide. Fruits cylindrical
Involucre of heads cylindrical, much longer than wide. Fruits strongly flattened
Stem somewhat woody, whitish, similar to a bone. Beak not dark, not shorter than the fruit body
Heads without ray flowers (all flowers tubular)
Leaves green-on upperside, white to grey-hairy on lowerside
Flowers at least in part white
Peripheral flowers white, central flowers yellow
Leaves green on upperside, grey- to white hairy on lowerside
Heads without ray flowers, not in umbrella-like corymbs
Corolla with a spur or with a sac-like swelling at base
Petals fused in a 2-lipped corolla. Fruit a capsule
Leaves paripinnate, ending with a tendril
Leaves imparipinnate, ending with a leaflet
Corolla yellowish with at least the keel violet
Leaves imparipinnate, ending with a leaflet
Leaves paripinnate, ending with a point or with a tendril
Inflorescence a compound umbel. Flowers white
Inflorescence at least 5 time as long as wide
Flowers in umbels or in globose heads
At least upper leaves ending with a tendril
Flowers solitary or in inflorescences with less than 7 flowers
Flowers in a raceme. Stipules green, without a dark spot
Leaflets max. 5 times as long as wide. Flowers never yellowish
Leaves not compound. Flowers not violet. Stems with tendrils
Leaves compound. Flowers violet. Stems without tendrils
Leaves >10 cm wide. Fruits flattened and winged at margin
Fruit oval, flattened, winged at margin
Fruit covered by spines or bristles
Fruit flattened and with 2 marginal wings
Involucre of umbel with more than 4 bracts
Segments of lower leaves >2 mm wide
Umbels with an involucre of numerous bracts
Fruit oval, max. 2 times as long as wide
Fruit cylindrical, at least 4 times as long as wide
Fruits biglobose, or linear and with a beak of 1-6 cm. Annual
Plant with a deep orange latex
Leaves compound. Flowers in a raceme
Flowers not in a raceme. Flowers in a spike surrounded by a whitish to yellowish bract
Margin of leaf segments entire. Fruits in a oval head
Plant woody at least at base, strongly smelling of rue
Basal leaves <20 cm long. Fruit rectangular in section. Beak <10% as long as the rest of fruit
Epicalyx absent. Fruits with a long beak
All leaves compound. Epicalyx with 5-13 segments
Leaves not compound, rounded in outline
Leaves compound, not rounded in outline
Leaves divided only to 2/3-4/5 of their length
Petals blue to violet. Plants not smelling of rue
Leaves >10 cm wide. Petals >3 cm long
Fruit >5 times as long as wide
Fruit <3 times as long as wide
Leaves divided almost to the central vein into <3 mm wide segments
Fruit triangular in outline, narrower at base and 2-lobed at the top
Basal leaves >5 cm wide and >30 cm long. Cultivated (cren)
Plant evergreen, with leaves (actually stems resembling leaves: cladodes) stinging only at the apex. Fruit fleshy
Flowers yellow, not in heads. Leaves <1 cm wide
Flowers violet, in heads. Leaves >1 cm wide
Leaves disposed in whorls at nodes
Petals pale blue, pink or violet
Petals fused at base, <8 mm long
Leaves parallel-veined. Flowers >3 cm wide. Calyx absent
Leaves not parallel-veined. Flowers <3 cm wide. Calyx present
Leaves linear to narrowly lanceolate. Petals 4, fused at base
Plant totally submeged or with floating leaves
Plant terrestrial or if aquatic with aerial leaves
At least the lower leaves with a truncate, hastate or heart-shaped base
Plants with a white latex (warning! wash your hands after having touched them: the latex is poisonous)
Leaves linear, at least 7 times as long as wide
Fruit smooth. Lateral branches with leaves not crowded into a kind of brush
Bracts of the cyathia triangular in outline
At least the basal leaves with a petiole
Leaf base clasping stem with a cylindrical sheath
Stems branched from the base. Stem leaves more than 50, max. 4(-5) cm long
Leaves flat, usually with long white hairs at margin. Capsule unilocular with 3 seeds (lens!)
Inflorescence viviparous, i.e. with bulbils producing small leaves instead of flowers
Stems not hollow, triangular to circular in section, without nodes. Leaf sheats not open. Flowers subtended by a single bract. Stigmas 2-3, usually borne on an evident style (CYPERACEAE)
Stems hollow, always circular to elliptic in section, with nodes. Flowers included between 2 bracts. Leaf sheaths usually open. Stigmas 2, sessile (POACEAE)
Flowers hermaphrodite (lens!), disposed in one or more, similar spikes
Flowers unisexual, usually disposed in male and female spikes (rarely in different parts of the same spike)
Spikes with flowers in 2 opposite rows
Spikes with flowers all around axis
All spikes similar, with both male and female flowers
Spikes different, the upper ones with male flowers, the lower ones with female flowers
All spikes in upper half of stem
With several linear spikes diverging at top of stem
With either a simple spike or a raceme
Inflorescence a simple spike, the spikelets sessile or very shortly stalked
Spikelets alternate on two opposite sides of stem
Spikelets with a single fertile flower (lens!)
Spikelets with more than one flower
Spikelets with a single fertile flower (lens!)
Awns >1 cm. Spikelets in groups of 3
Spikelets all round the spike axis
Spikelets not disposed all round the axis
Spikelets alternate on opposite sides of stem
Spikelets with the narrow edge fitting into depressions of the spike axis
Spikelets diverging from axis or appressed to it with the broader edge
Spikelets with a single fertile flower (lens!)
Inflorescence a contract raceme, either cylindrical and spike-like or with dense clusters of spikelets at least the lowest cluster with a long stalk
Spikelets >(2-) 3 times as long as wide, usually with more than 5 flowers and >4 mm long. Lower lemma not keeled (lens!)
Spikelets oval, max. 2-3 times as long as wide, with 4-5(-6) flowers, usually <4 mm long. Lower lemma keeled
Glumes obtuse to truncate. Plant of wet sites
Glumes acute. Plant absent from wet sites
Leaves flat or with revolute margins, >1 mm wide
Spikelets with a single fertile flower
Spikelets with more than one fertile flower
Glumes as long as or longer than spikelet
Awn not inserted between two teeth (lens!). Plant hairless or with very short hairs
Awn inserted between two teeth at top of lemma. Plant usually with long hairs at least on leaf sheaths
Plant of arid grasslands, often blue-green. All leaves thread-like, the ligule with two lateral auricles (lens!)
Flowers in heads with an involucre of bracts
Tubular (regular) flowers absent, all flowers ligulate (asymmetrical)
Tubular flowers present, ligulate flowers absent or present only at the margin of heads
Leaves not parallel-veined or veins indistinct
Bracts of the involucre disposed in more than 2 series. Fruits beakless
Bracts of the involucre in 1 or 2 series. Fruits ending with a long beak
Leaf margin entire. With creeping stolons
Fruits with a papppus of hairs (the pappus is visible also in the flower: open the head and observe the ovaries with a lens)
Stem leafless or with max. 4 well-developed leaves
Stem leaves narrowly linear. Fruit with a beak inserted in the center of a small crown (lens!)
Leaves clasping stem with base. Involucre of head >4 times as long as wide
Fruit tapering toward the top. Pappus snow-white, the hairs in more than one series (lens!)
Fruit truncate at top. Pappus dirty-white, the hairs in a single series
At least the basal leaves >1 cm wide
Leaves heart-shaped at base, petioled and >5 cm wide
Leaves not heart-shaped at base, or if heart-shaped then sessile and <5 cm wide
Heads with ray flowers. Heads solitary, produced before the basal leaves
Flowers not violet. Fruit without a pappus of hairs, covered by spines
Flowers purple to violet. Fruit with a pappus of hairs
Involucre globose, covered by hooked bracts and igle-like
Central flowers yellow, ray flowers white
At least some flowers white to whitish
Ray flowers >1.5 cm long and at least 2 mm wide
Ray flowers absent or <1.5 cm long and <2 mm wide
Ray flowers present (sometimes very short: lens!)
Heads <1 cm wide. Ray flowers short, erect
Heads >1 cm wide. Ray flowers spreading
At least the basal leaves >2 cm wide
Leaves >5 cm wide. Plant usually >15 dm tall
Bracts of involucre in 2 series, one of longer, the other of much shorter bracts
Fruits with a pappus of hairs
Inflorescence an umbel (warning! the umbels may be contracted and similar to heads)
Leaves lobate. Plant typical of walls, with creeping or hanging stems
Corolla with a spur or with a sac-like swelling
At least the basal leaves with a clear petiole
All petals fused. Calyx present. Leaves pinnately-veined or with indistinct veins
At least some petals free. Calyx absent. Leaves parallel-veined
Outer petals spreading, not curved into a kind of helmet
Outer petals curved into a kind of helmet
Inflorescence <4 times as long as wide
Inflorescence >4 times as long as wide
Central lobe of lip 2-lobed to bifid
Central lobe of lip with 2 shallow lobes. Bracts subtending flowers at least as long as 1/2 of ovary
Central lobe of lip deeply 2-lobed to bifid. Bracts very short, scale-like
Leaves not parallel-veined or veins indistinct
Petals 4, free, rounded at apex. Corolla not 2-lipped
Petals 5, fused, fringed at apex. Corolla 2-lipped
Leaves (at least the basal ones) >1 cm wide. Corolla with a long tube
Plant herbaceous. Petals fused at base. Fruit a capsule
Plant woody at least at base. Petals free. Fruit a legume
Lip (lower petal) mainly white to whitish
All petals white. Ovaries and fruits erect. Plant not in wet sites
Ovaries more or less erect. Lip usually >1.2 cm long. Fruits not drooping
Ovaries horizontal. Lip usually <1.2 cm long. Fruits drooping at maturity
Outer petals spreading. Lip not triangular
Lip entire or weakly 2-lobed at apex, the lateral lobes hairy
Petals fused at base. Leaves matt. Stems creeping. Fruits green, hairy
Petals free. Stems climbing. Leaves shiny. Fruit red, hairless
Petals free. Flowers <1 cm across, not bell-shaped. Fruit winged
Petals fused in a bell-shaped corolla >1 cm across. Fruit not winged
Petals fused in a bell-shaped corolla
Leaves hastate, petioled. stems winding. Flowers non in leaf axils
At least the basal leaves >2 cm long
Petals fused at least at base
Leaf base not truncate nor heart-shaped
Leaves strongly hairy. Petals 4. Flowers <2 cm wide
Fruit fleshy, surrounded by an orange papery involucre
Fruit a cluster of four 1-seeded nutlets (observe the ovary with a lens!). Corolla <3 cm and with a well-developed tube
Fruit a capsule. Corolla with a very short tube or if with a long tube then >3 cm
Corolla with a cylindrical tube and 5 radiating lobes
Corolla with a conical tube ending with 5 short teeth
Corolla with a very short tube, not bell-shaped
Filaments of stamens with violet hairs
Anthers very different in shape, only the 3 upper ones kidney-like
Petals fused at least at base
Flowering stems leafless, ending with a compact spike
Leaves much longer than wide, lanceolate
Leaves rarely >3 times as long as wide, ovate to elliptic
At least the basal leaves with a well-developed petiole
Leaf base not truncate nor heart-shaped
Leaves linear, strap-shaped. Flowers >5 mm wide, not in spikes nor in leaf-axils
Flowers in leafless spikes. At least the basal leaves petioled
Racemes simple. Plant with a bulb
Plant >1 dm tall, restricted to wet sites. Petals 3. Perennial
Fruit at least 5 times as long as wide
Fruit max. 2 times as long as wide
All leaves not hastate nor heart-shaped at base
At least the stem leaves with heart-shaped base or clasping the stem
Stem leaves sessile, not smelling of garlic
Fruit triangular in outline, narrower at base and 2-lobed at the top
Petals greenish at least in part
Petals fused at least at base
Leaf base not truncate nor heart-shaped
Leaves all basal. Petals more than 5. Stamens more than 10
Leaf base surrounding stem with a cylindrical sheath. Flowers in spikes
Leaves clearly petiolate, with dark spots
Petals <2 cm long, of equal length
Petals >2 cm long, different: 3 longer, 3 much shorter
Leaves absent at flowering or if present heart-shaped at base
Petals not blue. Flowers solitary, >2 cm long

Inflorescence not as above. Filaments of stamens in a single row
Leaf base more or less truncate
Leaves not 3-lobed. Capsule strongly flattened, heart-shaped at the top
Fruit a cluster of four 1-seeded nutlets (observe the ovary with a lens!)
Corolla ending with broad radiating lobes
At least the basal leaves >1 cm wide
Calyx teeth triangular (much wider at base)
